thread.title: Sarah Perkins was given an AFLW lifeline when she was selected as a free agent — and she’s paying the Crows back in spades | The Courier-Mail
thread.title_full: Sarah Perkins was given an AFLW lifeline when she was selected as a free agent — and she’s paying the Crows back in spades | The Courier-Mail

title: Sarah Perkins was given an AFLW lifeline when she was selected as a free agent — and she’s paying the Crows back in spades | The Courier-Mail
text:
Sarah Perkins was given an AFLW lifeline when she was selected as a free agent — and she’s paying the Crows back in spades Sarah Olle, FOX SPORTS February 10, 2017 9:53pm 
SARAH ‘Tex’ Perkins is quickly becoming one of the most endearing characters in the AFLW competition. 
Her story is one of persistence; a microcosm of the many stories that have chaptered the hardships faced and overcome to make it to the big stage. 
But for Perkins, the tale is particularly remarkable. 
Overlooked at the draft, it was a phone call from Adelaide coach Bec Goddard that reignited her AFLW dream. She was drafted as a free agent, having recently shed 40 kilograms. 
Already, the Eastern Devils forward has repaid that faith in spades. media_camera Sarah Perkins is becoming a cult figure in the AFLW. Photo: AAP Image/Tracey Nearmy 
“It’s nothing to do with me,” Goddard told Fox Footy after Adelaide’s 25-point upset. 
“Perko is a terrific person. She deserves the game she had tonight. She deserves to be playing with a great group of people like this and she belongs at the Crows.” 
So much so that she has already been likened to men’s skipper Taylor Walker. Hence the nickname, ‘Tex’. 
While Perkins is yet to cross paths with Walker, she indicated the pair had become acquainted before the first bounce. 
“I haven’t seen him around the club, but he did chuck me a cheeky little follow on Instagram and Twitter so I returned the favour,” Perkins said. 
“Hopefully I catch up with him this week after another good game.” 
Two goals later — and a win away from home — it was indeed another good game. 
To paraphrase Perkins: it was “absolutely amazing”. media_camera Sarah Perkins loves a celebration. Photo: Quinn Rooney/Getty Images 
Perkins’ leading patterns are terrific. She’s quick off the mark, uses her size to great effect, has a monstrous kick and loves a celebration. 
“It’s my trademark. I’ve done it at club level so I thought I might as well bring something different to the AFLW,” she said of her post-goal salute. 
Adelaide will assume favouritism for the AFLW flag after upsetting the Western Bulldogs at home. 
The win was emphatic, with the Crows’ stars Erin Phillips, Ebony Marinoff and Chelsea Randall all firing. 
Perkins revealed the win was all the more galvanising because of a delayed flight. 
“We were three hours delayed at the airport yesterday,” she said. 
“We’re going off no sleep here. I’m so proud of the girls.” 
The AFLW’s latest cult figure indicated life hadn’t changed too much for her since she shot to prominence last weekend. That is, except for a few new followers on social media. 
“I mentioned to a couple of the girls I was trying to go unnoticed and get through the game unscathed,” Perkins said. 
“But I don’t think that lasted five minutes.”
